result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thomas O Martinson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Cases called: 15CM356 & 15CM267, Defendant, Thomas O Martinson, appeared pro se. Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Right to attorney recited. Defendant waived attorney. Court went over the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest to count 2 in 15CM356. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment, sentence: $579.00 fine,  60 days to pay fine or set up a payment plan with Clerk of Courts. No jail credit.  In 15CM356, count one read in and dismissed. 15CM267 read in and dismissed. Fine paid in full out of $1,000 posted cash bond. Balance returned to poster.

No contact with A.B. or her residence, or employment.  May text A.B. only for child exchange and placement.  Defendant may return 1x to residence to obtain personal belongings and tools.  Previously posted cash bond will be returned.  Standard misd. conditions.

Defendant, Thomas O Martinson, appeared. Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  $2000.00 signature bond.  No contact with A.B. or her residence, or employment.  May text A.B. only for child exchange and placement.  Defendant may return 1x to residence to obtain personal belongings and tools.  Previously posted cash bond will be returned.  Standard misd. conditions.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 10, 2015 at 09:30 am.  Return date scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
